query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Al fine de le sue parole il ladro 2 le mani alzò con amendue le fiche, 3 gridando: «Togli, Dio, ch’a te le squadro!».
query.error: **English:** 1 At the end of his words, the thief 2 raised his hands with both his figs, 3 shouting: "Take them, God, for I am showing them to you!".
query.result: 1 Yn fin a’y gerow, an lader 2 a wra sevel y dhewdhow gans oll y fichow, 3 ow kewsel: “Kemmer, Duw, rag my a wra’n gulwel dhys!”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 Da indi in qua mi fuor le serpi amiche, 5 perch’ una li s’avvolse allora al collo, 6 come dicesse ‘Non vo’ che più diche’;
query.error: **English:** 4 From there on the serpents were friendly to me, 5 because one of them then coiled itself around my neck, 6 as if to say ‘I don’t want you to say any more’;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 e un’altra a le braccia, e rilegollo, 8 ribadendo sé stessa sì dinanzi, 9 che non potea con esse dare un crollo.
query.error: **English:** 7 and another one wrapped itself around my arms, 8 binding itself in front of me, 9 so that I could not move them.
query.result: 7 ha unn aral dhe’m bregh dhe’m dhelergh, 8 owth adhywrians henna hy honan kepar henna, 9 marnas ow kella owth henna owth gorra gwaya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Ahi Pistoia, Pistoia, ché non stanzi 11 d’incenerarti sì che più non duri, 12 poi che ’n mal fare il seme tuo avanzi?
query.error: **English:** 10 Ah Pistoia, Pistoia, why do you not resolve 11 to burn yourself so that you will no longer endure, 12 since your seed excels in wrongdoing?
query.result: 10 Ah Pistoia, Pistoia, rag nyns eus ow sevel 11 dhe’th loski hy honan marnas owth mos owth para, 12 wosa owth ow hadher dhe’th hadhow owth mos owth para?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Per tutt’ i cerchi de lo ’nferno scuri 14 non vidi spirto in Dio tanto superbo, 15 non quel che cadde a Tebe giù da’ muri.
query.error: **English:** 13 Throughout all the circles of the dark Inferno 14 I did not see a spirit so proud in God, 15 not even the one who fell from the walls down to Thebes.
query.result: 13 A-dreus oll an kelghyn a’n Ufferennow tywyll 14 nyns gweles i spyrys yn Dyw kemmys ow sevel, 15 nyns henna a-dheth dhe’n Thebes a-woles a’n mogheryow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 El si fuggì che non parlò più verbo; 17 e io vidi un centauro pien di rabbia 18 venir chiamando: «Ov’ è, ov’ è l’acerbo?».
query.error: **English:** 16 He fled so that he spoke no more words; 17 and I saw a centaur full of rage 18 coming, calling out: “Where is he, where is the fierce one?”.
query.result: 16 Ev a-dheth owth ow mos owth leverel moy ger, 17 ha my a welas unn centaur leun a-woles ow feth, 18 owth gorra owth galwos: “Peya, peya an garow?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Maremma non cred’ io che tante n’abbia, 20 quante bisce elli avea su per la groppa 21 infin ove comincia nostra labbia.
query.error: **English:** 19 I do not believe that the Maremma has so many, 20 as many serpents as he had on his back 21 right up to where our face begins.
query.result: 19 Maremma na grys vyth ow tos o perthi, 20 kepar ha bosow o perthi warbarth y groppa 21 bys dhe'n le powyth owr labbia a-dhalleth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Sovra le spalle, dietro da la coppa, 23 con l’ali aperte li giacea un draco; 24 e quello affuoca qualunque s’intoppa.
query.error: **English:** 22 Over his shoulders, behind the nape, 23 with open wings, a dragon lay; 24 and it sets fire to whomever it encounters.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Lo mio maestro disse: «Questi è Caco, 26 che, sotto ’l sasso di monte Aventino, 27 di sangue fece spesse volte laco.
query.error: **English:** 25 My master said: “This is Cacus, 26 who, beneath the rock of Aventine Mount, 27 often made a pool of blood.
query.result: 25 Dywhedhes vyster: “Henna yw Cacus, 26 neb, a-woles an garrek a-ugh Muns Aventinus, 27 a wrugha poos a woos gans кровь.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Non va co’ suoi fratei per un cammino, 29 per lo furto che frodolente fece 30 del grande armento ch’elli ebbe a vicino;
query.error: **English:** 28 He does not go with his brothers on the same path, 29 because of the thieving he deceitfully did 30 of the great herd that he had nearby;
query.result: 28 Nyns yw mos gans y’i vreuder war an keth path, 29 rag an ladra a wrug ef a-dreus, 30 a’n ergh bras o esedha ogas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 onde cessar le sue opere biece 32 sotto la mazza d’Ercule, che forse 33 gliene diè cento, e non sentì le diece».
query.error: **English:** 31 so his wicked deeds were ended 32 under the club of Hercules, who perhaps 33 gave him a hundred blows, and he did not feel the ten.
query.result: 31 Rag henna, y’i oberow drog a veu 32 a-woles massen Hercules, neb marnas 33 a roos kans dheg warn, ha nyns teves an deg.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Mentre che sì parlava, ed el trascorse, 35 e tre spiriti venner sotto noi, 36 de’ quai né io né ’l duca mio s’accorse,
query.error: **English:** 34 While he spoke thus, and he passed by, 35 and three spirits came beneath us, 36 of whom neither I nor my leader was aware,
query.result: 34 Tra veur nag esa dallethov, hag ef a dremena, 35 ha tri speris a dheuth a-woles agan, 36 neb nyns esa ow nag vyster ow kows,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 se non quando gridar: «Chi siete voi?»; 38 per che nostra novella si ristette, 39 e intendemmo pur ad essi poi.
query.error: **English:** 37 except when they cried out: “Who are you?”; 38 because of which our conversation stopped, 39 and we only paid attention to them then.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Io non li conoscea; ma ei seguette, 41 come suol seguitar per alcun caso, 42 che l’un nomar un altro convenette,
query.error: **English:** 40 I did not know them; but he followed them, 41 as one usually follows by chance, 42 so that one had to name another,
query.result: 40 Nyns esa owth aswon; mes ef a sewya, 41 dell yw an gwella sewya rag nebes kas, 42 mar esa owth rekis aga hanow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 dicendo: «Cianfa dove fia rimaso?»; 44 per ch’io, acciò che ’l duca stesse attento, 45 mi puosi ’l dito su dal mento al naso.
query.error: **English:** 43 saying: “Cianfa, where will he have remained?”; 44 because of which, so that the leader would pay attention, 45 I put my finger from my chin to my nose.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Se tu se’ or, lettore, a creder lento 47 ciò ch’io dirò, non sarà maraviglia, 48 ché io che ’l vidi, a pena il mi consento.
query.error: **English:** 46 If you, reader, are slow to believe 47 what I will say, it will not be surprising, 48 for I who saw it, scarcely believe it myself.
query.result: 46 Mar tus ow, lenor, dhe gresi yn lent 47 an pyth vyth wra vyth leverel, nyns yw margh, 48 rag ow a’y gwelas, a-berth dhe gresi dhe’m honan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Com’ io tenea levate in lor le ciglia, 50 e un serpente con sei piè si lancia 51 dinanzi a l’uno, e tutto a lui s’appiglia.
query.error: **English:** 49 As I held my eyebrows raised towards them, 50 a serpent with six feet hurls itself 51 in front of one of them, and clings to him entirely.
query.result: 49 Pandravtennavowynkolgowyn, 50 ha bronn gans wheth es launsa 51 rag dhe'n unn, ha dhe hys oll es keffrys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 li diretani a le cosce distese, 56 e miseli la coda tra ’mbedue 57 e dietro per le ren sù la ritese.
query.error: **English:** 55 its hind feet it stretched out along his thighs, 56 and put its tail between the two of them, 57 and behind, up his loins, it raised it.
query.result: 55 Y’ganavas y dresel a-ugh y eskern, 56 ha y’ganavas y lost a-dro dhe’n dhew, 57 ha y’ganavas y lost a-ugh y eskern.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Ellera abbarbicata mai non fue 59 ad alber sì, come l’orribil fiera 60 per l’altrui membra avviticchiò le sue.
query.error: **English:** 58 Ivy never clung so tightly 59 to a tree, as the horrible beast 60 entwined its own limbs around the other's.
query.result: 58 Hedra bythkweth na veu moy 59 dhe gwedhen, dell an best dreus 60 a-dro dhe esel arall y’ganavas y esel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Poi s’appiccar, come di calda cera 62 fossero stati, e mischiar lor colore, 63 né l’un né l’altro già parea quel ch’era:
query.error: **English:** 61 Then they stuck together, as if they were 62 made of hot wax, and their colors mingled, 63 neither the one nor the other now seemed what it was:
query.result: 61 Wosa henna y’ganavas dhe’n gilynn, 62 dell o wax kowm o ve, ha’gas y liw, 63 na’n unn na’n arall a veu moy henna o ve:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 come procede innanzi da l’ardore, 65 per lo papiro suso, un color bruno 66 che non è nero ancora e ’l bianco more.
query.error: **English:** 64 as a brown color advances before the heat, 65 over the papyrus, a brown color 66 that is not yet black and the white dies.
query.result: 64 Dell an gwels dhe’n fordh rag an tommder, 65 a-ugh an papir, liw brons, 66 na veu moy du, ha’n wenn a veu marow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Li altri due ’l riguardavano, e ciascuno 68 gridava: «Omè, Agnel, come ti muti! 69 Vedi che già non se’ né due né uno».
query.error: **English:** 67 The other two were watching him, and each one 68 cried out: "Oh me, Agnello, how you are changing! 69 See that you are now neither two nor one."
query.result: 67 An dhew arall a veu moy ow tos, ha pub unn 68 a leveris: "Ow, Agnel, pyth yw ow chanj! 69 Gwels es na’s keth moy unn na dhew."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Già eran li due capi un divenuti, 71 quando n’apparver due figure miste 72 in una faccia, ov’ eran due perduti.
query.error: **English:** 70 Now the two heads had become one, 71 when there appeared two figures mixed 72 in one face, where two were lost.
query.result: 70 Wosa henna an dhew benen moy unn, 71 pan veu moy dhew figyer keverys 72 yn unn fas, le mayth veu moy unn kolles.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Fersi le braccia due di quattro liste; 74 le cosce con le gambe e ’l ventre e ’l casso 75 divenner membra che non fuor mai viste.
query.error: **English:** 73 The four arms became two arms; 74 the thighs with the legs and the belly and the chest 75 became members that were never seen before.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Ogne primaio aspetto ivi era casso: 77 due e nessun l’imagine perversa 78 parea; e tal sen gio con lento passo.
query.error: **English:** 76 Every original aspect there was lost: 77 the perverse image seemed two and none, 78 and in this way it went with slow pace.
query.result: 76 Pub unn kynsa gwella kynsa o ve: 77 Dhew ha neb an imaj pervers 78 a veu moy; ha dell henna a veu moy gans pass lent.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Come ’l ramarro sotto la gran fersa 80 dei dì canicular, cangiando sepe, 81 folgore par se la via attraversa,
query.error: **English:** 79 Like the lizard under the great heat 80 of the dog days, changing its hedge, 81 seems like lightning if it crosses the road,
query.result: 79 Dell an lavar dro dhe’n tommder bras 80 a’n dedh kanikular, ow chanjya sepi, 81 fulgor a veu moy pan drehedhya an fordh,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 sì pareva, venendo verso l’epe 83 de li altri due, un serpentello acceso, 84 livido e nero come gran di pepe;
query.error: **English:** 82 so it seemed, coming towards the navel 83 of the other two, a little snake, fiery, 84 livid and black like a peppercorn;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 e quella parte onde prima è preso 86 nostro alimento, a l’un di lor trafisse; 87 poi cadde giuso innanzi lui disteso.
query.error: **English:** 85 and that part where our nourishment is first taken, 86 it pierced in one of them; 87 then it fell down stretched out before him.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Lo trafitto ’l mirò, ma nulla disse; 89 anzi, co’ piè fermati, sbadigliava 90 pur come sonno o febbre l’assalisse.
query.error: **English:** 88 The one who was pierced looked at him, but said nothing; 89 instead, with his feet planted, he yawned 90 just as if sleep or fever were attacking him.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Elli ’l serpente e quei lui riguardava; 92 l’un per la piaga e l’altro per la bocca 93 fummavan forte, e ’l fummo si scontrava.
query.error: **English:** 91 The serpent and he stared at each other; 92 one through the wound and the other through the mouth 93 they puffed hard, and the smoke met.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Taccia Lucano ormai là dov’ e’ tocca 95 del misero Sabello e di Nasidio, 96 e attenda a udir quel ch’or si scocca.
query.error: **English:** 94 Let Lucan now be silent where he touches 95 on wretched Sabellus and Nasidius, 96 and listen to what is now being shot forth.
query.result: 94 Lettya Lucan brena ma na’n leveryas 95 a-dro dhe Sabello truan ha Nasidio, 96 ha goslow dhe glywes an peth a wra skwydhys bys vy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Taccia di Cadmo e d’Aretusa Ovidio, 98 ché se quello in serpente e quella in fonte 99 converte poetando, io non lo ’nvidio;
query.error: **English:** 97 Let Ovid be silent about Cadmus and Arethusa, 98 for if he, in his poetry, transformed the former into a serpent and the latter into a fountain, I do not envy him; 99 for never did he transmute two natures face to face

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 ché due nature mai a fronte a fronte 101 non trasmutò sì ch’amendue le forme 102 a cambiar lor matera fosser pronte.
query.error: **English:** 100 so that both forms were ready to change their matter.
query.result: 100 rag nyns yw treylya dhew vagas dhe vagas 101 nyns yw treylya dhew vagas dhe vagas 102 dhe bys vy dhe chanjya aga matera o ve prest.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Insieme si rispuosero a tai norme, 104 che ’l serpente la coda in forca fesse, 105 e ’l feruto ristrinse insieme l’orme.
query.error: **English:** 103 Together they responded to such rules, 104 that the serpent made its tail into a fork, 105 and the wounded one drew its steps together.
query.result: 103 Yn-kever onan a wra gordhys dhe’n rewl, 104 an nadha a wra y honan yn forc, 105 hag an onan gwaythys a wra junya y gammow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Le gambe con le cosce seco stesse 107 s’appiccar sì, che ’n poco la giuntura 108 non facea segno alcun che si paresse.
query.error: **English:** 106 Its legs, with its thighs joined to them, 107 stuck together so that, in a short while, 108 the joint showed no sign of being there.
query.result: 106 Y gesyk gans y eskern a wra junyes 107 yn-kever, bys vy yn skon a wra’n junyes 108 an joynt nyns o wra gweles sygnal dhe vos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Togliea la coda fessa la figura 110 che si perdeva là, e la sua pelle 111 si facea molle, e quella di là dura.
query.error: **English:** 109 The forked tail took on the shape 110 that was being lost there, and its skin 111 became soft, and that of the other hard.
query.result: 109 An honan fessa a wra kemer an shap 110 a wra gollet ena, hag y croen 111 a wra junya moylyes, hag henna a wra kalet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Io vidi intrar le braccia per l’ascelle, 113 e i due piè de la fiera, ch’eran corti, 114 tanto allungar quanto accorciavan quelle.
query.error: **English:** 112 I saw the arms enter through the armpits, 113 and the two feet of the beast, which were short, 114 lengthen as much as the others shortened.
query.result: 112 Vy a welas an bregh enter dre’n ascell, 113 hag an dew dreth a’n best, o vos byskyn, 114 a wra junya hir avel orth an remenyn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Poscia li piè di rietro, insieme attorti, 116 diventaron lo membro che l’uom cela, 117 e ’l misero del suo n’avea due porti.
query.error: **English:** 115 Then the hind feet, twisted together, 116 became the member that man conceals, 117 and the wretch had two of his own carried away.
query.result: 115 Wosa henna an dew a-dhyworth, junyes yn-kever, 116 a wra junya an esel a wra gollet gans den, 117 hag an truan a wra dew dhe y honan kemer.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Mentre che ’l fummo l’uno e l’altro vela 119 di color novo, e genera ’l pel suso 120 per l’una parte e da l’altra il dipela,
query.error: **English:** 118 While the smoke veils both of them 119 with a new color, and generates fur above 120 on one side and strips it off on the other,
query.result: 118 Tra veur an fum a wra gollet an dew 119 gans liw nowydh, hag a wra gwruthyl an blew 120 a-ugh unn tu ha’n dipel a-ugh an tu arall,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 l’un si levò e l’altro cadde giuso, 122 non torcendo però le lucerne empie, 123 sotto le quai ciascun cambiava muso.
query.error: **English:** 121 one rose up and the other fell down, 122 but without turning their wicked eyes, 123 beneath which each one changed face.
query.result: 121 Unn a wra sevel ha’n arall a wra kodha, 122 Mes nyns o wra trohya aga golwg kalet, 123 A-woles aga dew a wra chanjya aga fas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Quel ch’era dritto, il trasse ver’ le tempie, 125 e di troppa matera ch’in là venne 126 uscir li orecchi de le gote scempie;
query.error: **English:** 124 That which was straight, he drew towards the temples, 125 and from the excess of matter that came there 126 the ears emerged from the smooth cheeks;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 ciò che non corse in dietro e si ritenne 128 di quel soverchio, fé naso a la faccia 129 e le labbra ingrossò quanto convenne.
query.error: **English:** 127 what did not run back and was retained 128 of that excess, made a nose for the face 129 and thickened the lips as much as was fitting.
query.result: 127 An peth nyns o wra redya ha’n golla, 128 A-dhyworth an moylyes, a wra gwruthyl an fron 129 Hag a wra junya an lippyow kalet avel o vos fyttes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Quel che giacëa, il muso innanzi caccia, 131 e li orecchi ritira per la testa 132 come face le corna la lumaccia;
query.error: **English:** 130 That which lay, thrusts its snout forward, 131 and draws its ears back through its head, 132 as a snail does its horns;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 e la lingua, ch’avëa unita e presta 134 prima a parlar, si fende, e la forcuta 135 ne l’altro si richiude; e ’l fummo resta.
query.error: **English:** 133 and the tongue, which it had united and ready 134 to speak before, splits, and the forked 135 part closes again in the other; and the smoke remains.
query.result: 133 ha’y thavod, a veu unys ha prest 134 rag kewsel kyns, a rann, ha’n forkas 135 a-gledha yn-dann yn y gila; ha’n moyth a wra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 L’anima ch’era fiera divenuta, 137 suffolando si fugge per la valle, 138 e l’altro dietro a lui parlando sputa.
query.error: **English:** 136 The soul that had become fierce, 137 hissing, flees through the valley, 138 and the other spits after it, speaking.
query.result: 136 An eneval a veu feth, 137 a-sifella hag a-hedhi dre’n glyn, 138 hag y gila wosa dhodho, a-spuwya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Poscia li volse le novelle spalle, 140 e disse a l’altro: «I’ vo’ che Buoso corra, 141 com’ ho fatt’ io, carpon per questo calle».
query.error: **English:** 139 Then he turned his new shoulders, 140 and said to the other: "I want Buoso to run, 141 as I have done, on all fours along this path."
query.result: 139 Wosa henna, ev a droes y skenn nowyth, 140 hag a leveris dhe’n gila: “My a vyn Buoso resek, 141 kepar ha’m gwreys i, war-lergh war-ves an fordh ma.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
142 Così vid’ io la settima zavorra 143 mutare e trasmutare; e qui mi scusi 144 la novità se fior la penna abborra.
query.error: **English:** 142 Thus I saw the seventh ballast 143 change and transform; and here let the novelty 144 excuse me if my pen shuns the flower.
query.result: 142 Henwys vyth an garth balast 143 a wra chanjys ha treusys; ha yma diskul 144 an nowydh vy, pub sodho an pluen an bleujen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
145 E avvegna che li occhi miei confusi 146 fossero alquanto e l’animo smagato, 147 non poter quei fuggirsi tanto chiusi,
query.error: **English:** 145 And although my eyes were somewhat confused 146 and my mind bewildered, 147 they could not flee so hidden,
query.result: 145 Ha byttegen le may fleghes konfus 146 hag an eneval skevens, 147 ny alla an re a-hedhi dhe-unanj konfus,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
151 l’altr’ era quel che tu, Gaville, piagni.
query.error: **English:** 151 the other was the one whom you, Gaville, mourn.
query.result: 151 an aral veu henna a-weles Gaville.
